about.title: About Atlas Composer
about.intro: A sandbox to experiment with composite geographic projections, allowing representation of distant territories with preserved size ratios.

challenge.title: The cartographic challenge
challenge.description1: Representing a country and its geographically scattered territories on the same map poses a challenge: how to display together areas separated by thousands of kilometers while maintaining visual coherence?
challenge.description2: The classic solution uses repositioned insets: the Albers USA projection, for example, integrates Alaska and Hawaii in frames moved near the American continent.
challenge.description3: Unlike the United States, France does not have a standardized composite projection to visualize together the mainland and the overseas departments/collectivities (Caribbean, Guiana, Indian Ocean, Pacific) with coherent proportions and positioning.

solution.title: The approach: interactive composite projections
solution.description: This project leverages D3.js capabilities to create interactive composite projections, inspired by Roger Veciana's research via the d3-composite-projections library.

features.title: Key features
features.compositeExisting: Existing composite: Apply professional geographic projections (France, Portugal, Europe) already configured and validated
features.compositeCustom: Custom composite: Build your own assembly by precisely controlling the position, orientation, and scale of each region
features.split: Separate views: Display each territory in its own projection, respecting real geographic proportions
features.unified: Unified view: Brings all territories together in a single projection (to observe distortions)

atlases.title: Supported regions
atlases.france: France: Mainland + overseas departments and territories (Guadeloupe, Martinique, French Guiana, Réunion, Mayotte, Saint-Pierre-et-Miquelon, Saint-Martin, Saint-Barthélemy, Wallis-et-Futuna, French Polynesia, New Caledonia)
atlases.eu: European Union: 27 member states with composite Europe projection

technologies.title: Technologies
technologies.vue: Vue 3 + TypeScript: Reactive and typed interface
technologies.topojson: TopoJSON: Optimized geographic data (Natural Earth, OpenStreetMap)
